column1: As our campaign shifts into high gear we are proud to welcome the endorsement of the AFL / CIO the largest federation of unions in the country representing 12.5 million working men and women.    #proudunion #proudunionhome #Unions #unionproud https://t.co/v5ieXnv9G8

It’s shameful that my opponent said the Blue Dogs coalition “supports child abuse.” The Blue Dogs include many devoted mothers & fathers who work hard to do the right thing for our country. It’s disrespectful to them & child abuse victims to use such irresponsible rhetoric #IL03 https://t.co/Y99SOe2YWd

Exactly. The purity tests my opponent and AOC demand are incredibly short-sighted and harmful to the party’s chances to pick up seats. I support bringing people together to build coalitions not casting out non-conformists. #IL03 #twill https://t.co/tNpRhOCy4e

@WalshRide If you’re referring to common sense as a thing itself it’s two words. If on the other hand you’re using commonsense as a descriptor of something else it's one word.
@Historygeek51 @mattoshea19 @SenCunningham @repfranhurley35 Please follow my official account for official content. Have a great NYE Bob!

Congrats to all the lucky bingo winners today! I had a great time at @mattoshea19’s NYE Pizza Party in Mt Greenwood. Thanks to Ald. O’Shea @SenCunningham & @repfranhurley35 for putting it together. Wishing everyone in #IL03 a happy New Year! https://t.co/YDOIEv316F

Holiday break is a great time to make sure that the voices of every voter in your house will be heard on 3/17. Get your absentee ballot requests in so that your vote is counted to keep our opponents' extreme policies out of DC! #mainstream2020 #IL03  https://t.co/SsLtYvNN8H https://t.co/8dIOXssPIB

My opponents talk a lot about healthcare but talk is cheap. There was a recent court ruling that leaves #ACA under threat of being overturned but I won’t just be voicing concerns about it. When I return to DC I'll keep fighting to protect coverage for #PreexistingConditions #IL03 https://t.co/KwyEfIsqHL

Merry Christmas from the Lipinskis! Here’s a look at our #Nativity which is over 50 years old as well as some of the ornaments we’ve collected from our travels over the years. Wishing the very best to you and your families. #MerryChristmas #ChristmasDay2019 #IL03 https://t.co/sq0ZCsKEV0
From my family to yours I wish you a blessed holiday season Merry Christmas and a happy and healthy New Year. #HappyHolidays #MerryChristmas #HappyHanukkah https://t.co/9jwRNlnS2d

Lockport! Thanks to all the Porters I met at our meet and greet today for the enthusiastic response! I heard your feedback about the need for #commonsense solutions to get things done & couldn’t agree more. Special thanks to the Balonek family for hosting! #mainstream2020 https://t.co/TPZdEdNLgT

So many residents of the Third District rely on public transit to get to work ON TIME. Increasing delays on @Metra and @Amtrak are unacceptable.  I authored a provision that will require a Chicagoland performance study to minimize commuter delays.#gettoworkontime #accountability https://t.co/C2ZzS9Qrlx
Had a great meet and greet down in  the #11thward today. The welcome in Bridgeport is always amazing. Thank you to everyone who made it out. #IL03 #mainstream2020 https://t.co/UdidOHdSxR

Enjoyed celebrating the Feast of Our Lady of Guadalupe at St. Richard Parish in Archer Heights. Terrific opportunity to meet Tinley Park supporters to discuss the issues most important to the voters of the 3rd Congressional District.  It’s clear:  it’s my #mainstream #commonsense policies vs. the #extreme.  Thank you Pat Rea and friends for you holiday hospitality! https://t.co/6jj8nF2T9d

As a member of the House Climate Solutions Caucus I've fought for bipartisan solutions & realistic policies to combat climate change head-on. I’ve fought to promote energy efficiency reduce greenhouse gas emissions & ensure that all Americans have safe drinking water. (2/2)

The time for Congress to take action to combat climate change is now. This is an issue that hits close to home for Illinoisians. Climate change poses an immediate threat to the Great Lakes our drinking water and our air quality. (1/2)
